question: I have anxiety, now I'm on medicine?
question_content:
I have been for the longest time afraid of doing alot of stuff. (Going certain places, talking to certain people, confrontations, etc) when I would attempt to do or even think about doing alot of things I would get what felt like an adrenaline rush in my stomach and I couldn't stop thinking about it and worrying about it. I finnaly spoke with my doctor and got medicine yesterday. Idk if it is working or if I think it's working. But I'm not getting that put in my stomach so far. Only thing is idk about my thinking, I've been a certain way for so long so everything I was scared of before I still think I am even tho I don't feel like I am. Will this get better or what... I just don't fully understand what I'm going thru. 
P.s. I've suffered from anxiety for years just been to afraid to tell a doctor. I've been on my medication since yesterday

answers.answer_content:
The medicine will help control it and over time you will start to associate the things you were scared of with more pleasant feelings. 

Keep taking your medicine and going for your checkups

Hello.
Dont worry, anxiety is a very common problem, your not alone. 
My brother was servely depressed and suffered really really bad anxiety, sometimes he didn't even go to school because he had a panic attack.
He used to be on meds but now his not. 
Don't be so hard on yourself, it's only been a day on treatment, it won't work within hours, you need to give yourself time. When you feel sick or anxious, just remember to breathe.

Goodluck xx
